qas.question: Who was crucified with Jesus per Mark?
How does Mark say Jesus' life ends?

answers.text: Jesus calls out to God, then gives a shout and dies

qas.question: what natural disaster is mention when Jesus died?
What does Luke say one of the rebels does?

answers.text: promises that he (Jesus) and the criminal will be together in paradise

qas.question: How does Luke make Jesus seem at his Crucifixion?
How long were the two rebels hanging on crosses?
How was one criminal treated when crucified compared to the other?
What did one of the criminals do before he died from being crucified?
What happened to the clothes one of the criminals was wearing?
How did the criminals react to their own crucifixion?

context: In Mark, Jesus is crucified along with <a0_0>two rebels<a0_0/>, and the day goes dark for <b5_0>three hours<b5_0/>. <a1_0>Jesus calls out to God, then <b7_0>gives a shout<b7_0/> and dies<a1_0/>. The curtain of the Temple is <b8_0>torn in two<b8_0/>. Matthew follows Mark, adding <a2_0>an earthquake<a2_0/> and the resurrection of saints. Luke also follows Mark, though he describes the rebels as common criminals, one of whom defends Jesus, who in turn <a3_0>promises that he (Jesus) and the criminal will be together in paradise<a3_0/>. Luke portrays Jesus as <a4_0><b9_0>impassive<b9_0/><a4_0/> in the face of his crucifixion. John includes several of the same elements as those found in Mark, though they are treated <b6_0>differently<b6_0/>.
